verses.text: 巴比倫王伯沙撒第一年，但以理躺在床上時，他作了一個夢，腦海中出現了異象；他就把那夢記錄下來，把事情的重點述說出來。

words.note: Lit. 'in the sea of the brain'
Lit. 'strange phenomenon'

verses.text: 但以理說：「在夜間的異象中，我看見天的四風，攪動大海。

words.note: Lit. 'strange phenomenon'

verses.text: 「有四隻巨獸從海中上來，形狀各不相同。

words.note: Lit. 'each not mutually the same'

verses.text: 第一隻獸像獅子，卻有鷹的翅膀。我一直在觀看，看見牠的翅膀被拔去，牠從地上被舉起來，兩腳像人一樣直立在地上；又有人的心給了牠。
我又看見另一隻獸，就是第二隻獸；牠和熊相似，挺起一邊的身軀，口中的牙齒銜著三根肋骨。有人這樣對牠說：『起來，吃多量的肉吧！』
此後，我繼續觀看，看見另一隻獸像豹，背上有鳥的四個翅膀；這獸有四個頭，又有權柄給了牠。

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts.

verses.text: 後來，我在夜間的異象中繼續觀看，看見有第四隻獸，非常恐怖，十分可怕，極其強壯。牠有大鐵牙；牠吞吃咬碎，又把剩餘的用腳踐踏；這獸和前面的各獸都不相同；牠有十個角。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual visions in religious texts.
Lit. 'not ordinary'.
Lit. 'ten parts' or 'completely'.

verses.text: 我正在究察這些角的時候，看見角的中間長出另一個小角來。在這小角前面，有三個先前的角連根被拔起來。這小角有眼，像人的眼，又有一張說誇大話的嘴。

words.note: Indicates an action in progress.
More formal or literary than '調查 (diàochá)'.
Emphasizes thoroughness, 'by the root'.
Indicates upward movement or beginning of an action.
A verb-object compound: 'to speak boastful words'.

verses.text: 「我一直在觀看，看見有些寶座安放好了，萬古常存者就坐上去；他的衣服潔白如雪，他的頭髮純淨像羊毛。他的寶座是火燄，寶座的輪子是烈火。

words.note: Indicates continuous action when preceding a verb.
Lit. 'precious seat'.
Indicates a state of readiness or completion.
A descriptive title for God in the Bible.
Implies intense, consuming fire.

verses.text: 有火像河湧出，烈火從他面前冒出；事奉他的有千千，侍立在他面前的有萬萬。審判已經開始，案卷都展開了。

words.note: Implies intense, consuming fire.
Specifically refers to serving a deity or high authority.
Repetition emphasizes immense quantity.
Formal term for attending to a superior.
Repetition emphasizes an incalculably large number.
Refers to ancient records or books of law/judgment.

verses.text: 「那時，因那小角說誇大話的聲音，我繼續觀看，看見那獸被殺，屍體被毀，扔在烈火中。

words.note: A symbolic figure in Daniel.
A verb-object compound.
Often symbolic in biblical context.
Often used in a spiritual or metaphorical sense in scripture.

verses.text: 至於其餘的三獸，牠們的權柄都被奪去，牠們的生命卻得著延長，直到所定的時候和日期。

words.note: Refers to governing power or divine authority.
Literally 'obtain and achieve'.

verses.text: 「我在夜間的異象中繼續觀看，看見有一位像人子的，駕著天雲而來，到萬古常存者那裡，被引領到他面前，

words.note: A supernatural sight or revelation.
A title for a divine figure, especially in Daniel and the Gospels.
Used to describe coming in a particular manner or as a result.
A title for God in Daniel, emphasizing eternal existence.

verses.text: 得了權柄、尊榮和國度；各國、各族和說各種語言的人都事奉他。他的權柄是永遠的權柄，是不能廢去的；他的國度是永不毀滅的。

words.note: Refers to a realm or sphere of rule.
Implies devoted service or worship, often to a deity.

verses.text: 「至於我但以理，我的靈在我裡面憂傷，我腦海中出現的異象使我驚惶。

words.note: Can refer to human spirit or Holy Spirit.
Literally 'brain sea', refers to the mind's depths.

verses.heading: An Angel Interprets Daniel’s Vision

verses.text: 於是我走近其中一位侍立者，問他有關這一切事的實情；他就告訴我，使我知道這些事的意思，他說：

words.note: Refers to a divine being or angel standing before God.

verses.text: 『這四隻巨獸就是將要在世上興起的四個王。

words.note: Often used in biblical prophecy or fantasy.

verses.text: 但至高者的聖民必要得國，擁有這國，直到永永遠遠。』

words.note: A common biblical title for God.
Refers to God's chosen or consecrated people.
A verb-object compound, specific to acquiring a kingdom.
A reduplicated idiom, common in biblical texts to express eternity.

verses.text: 那時我想知道有關第四隻獸的實情，牠和其他三獸不相同，十分恐怖，有鐵牙銅爪；牠吞吃咬碎，又把剩餘的用腳踐踏。

words.note: Literally 'ten parts', meaning 'completely' or 'very much'.

verses.text: 我又想知道有關牠頭上的十角，和那另長出來的小角，以及那三個在這小角前面倒下的角的實情。這小角有眼，有說誇大話的嘴；牠的形狀比牠的同類更威猛。

words.note: A common phrase meaning to speak boastfully or arrogantly.

verses.text: 我繼續觀看，看見這小角和聖民爭戰，戰勝了他們，

words.note: A symbolic entity in Daniel's prophecy.

verses.text: 直到萬古常存者來到，為至高者的聖民伸張正義；聖民擁有國度的時候就到了。

words.note: A title for God in the book of Daniel.
A title for God.
Often refers to God's Kingdom in biblical context.

verses.text: 「那位侍立者這樣說：『那第四隻獸就是世上必有的第四國，和其他各國都不相同；牠必吞吃全地，踐踏咬碎全地。

words.note: Refers to an angel interpreting the vision.
Symbolic of a kingdom in prophecy.
Refers to a specific kingdom in Daniel's prophecy.

verses.text: 至於那十角，就是從這國中將要興起的十個王，在他們以後，必有另一個王興起，和先前的王都不相同；他必制伏三個王。

words.note: Symbolic of ten kings/kingdoms.

verses.text: 他必說話，敵擋至高者；他必折磨至高者的聖民，又想改變節期和律法；聖民必交在他的手中，一載、二載、半載（「一載、二載、半載」或譯：「一個時期、多個時期、半個時期」）。

words.note: A title for God.
A title for God.
Refers to religious feasts and appointed seasons.
Often refers to the Mosaic Law in biblical context.
Prophetic period, often interpreted as one year.
Prophetic period, often interpreted as two years.
Prophetic period, often interpreted as half a year.

verses.text: 但審判要開始，他的權柄必被奪去，他必被毀壞滅絕，直到永遠。

words.note: Indicates future action or intention.
Refers to the beast/power from previous verses.
Expresses strong certainty or necessity.
Refers to the beast/power from previous verses.
Expresses strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 那時，國度、權柄，和普天之下萬國的大權，都必賜給至高者的聖民。他的國是永遠的國；所有掌權的都必事奉他，順從他。』

words.note: Literally 'under the whole sky'.
Expresses strong certainty or necessity.
Refers to God, the Most High.
Refers to the Most High.
Literally 'those who hold power'.
Expresses strong certainty or necessity.
Refers to the Most High.
Refers to the Most High.

verses.text: 這事到此完畢。我但以理心中十分驚惶，臉色也變了，但我把這事存放在心裡。」
